alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 6:46AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF LIGHT SNOW AND A CHANCE OF FREEZING RAIN THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... Periods of light wintry precipitation are expected across the Anchorage Bowl and western Kenai Peninsula through Sunday morning. Precipitation is expected to develop across the southern Kenai Peninsula this morning and overspread the rest of the western Kenai Peninsula and Anchorage Bowl by early Saturday afternoon. The precipitation is expected to begin as snow, but could transition to a mix of light snow and freezing rain as warmer air aloft moves overhead. The wintry mix is expected to end as light snow by late Sunday morning. The best chance for precipitation will be Saturday afternoon and evening and again early Sunday morning. There is still some uncertainty as to the extent of the warm air aloft and what the predominant precipitation type will be. Whether snow or freezing rain is the predominant precipitation type, any precipitation is expected to be light, with less than an inch of snow and a light glaze of ice expected. For the latest forecast visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
